banner.title: Be A Part of Waste4Change, Be A Part of the Change

culture.title: Our Culture
culture.subtitle: Here's A Glimpse of What Life at Waste4Change Looks Like

job_category.title: Job Categories
job_category.subtitle: What Are You Most Passionate About?

testimony.title: Testimonial
testimony.subtitle: Hear What Our Employees Have to Say throughout their Career with Waste4Change

items.name: Adhitya Prayoga
items.message: I have found my Ikigai by working at Waste4Change. I do not need to make up stories when the future generation asks me "What did you do in the fight against climate change?" I can proudly say "I did it with Waste4Change".

items.name: Saka Dwi Hanggara
items.message: I found great colleagues and a fun working environment here at Waste4Change. In addition, I take pride in the works that we perform because we know that  we're doing something great!

items.name: Khairunnisa Yusmalina Humaam
items.message: I joined Waste4Change ever since its organic waste processing methods were still very simple, and now we already have 2 effective organic waste processing methods, which are Open Windrow and Black Soldier Flies. From that process alone, I learned a lot about leadership, strategic thinking, and solution-based mindset. There is not a more suitable place for those who want to keep learning and develop themselves than in Waste4Change

items.name: Muhamad Andriansyah
items.message: Working in Waste4Change has enabled me to gain a holistic understanding about the recycling industry, as well as learning about its business process from upstream to downstream. Moreover I also managed to obtain knowledge regarding the business opportunity in waste management sector, all while contributing to the environment

items.name: Siti Annisa
items.message: Waste4Change has become one of the places in which I can contribute both in knowledge and concrete actions to initiate real environmental changes. As a graduate from Environmental Engineering, it is very thrilling to be able to work in Waste4Change. This is because I get to know many colleagues and friends who are very supportive towards each other, while at the same time, I am given the opportunity (and the luxury) to implement the knowledge that I have obtained

internship_program.title: W4C INTERNSHIP PROGRAM
internship_program.subtitle: An Exciting 3-month Internship Program for You to Discover and Explore Your Passion in Waste Management Issues
internship_program.message: Description: Becoming an intern at Waste4Change means a full-time experience that simulates the dynamic working conditions here at Waste4Change's office for a duration of 3 months. Interns can choose which division they want to be a part of, or what kind of cause they want to be involved in.

internship_testimony.title: Past Intern Testimoniis
internship_testimony.subtitle: See What Our Past Interns Have to Say About Waste4Change's Internship Program

items.name: Amira R. Nadhifa
items.message: The whole experience taught me a lot of things, starting with interpersonal communication, teamwork, and problem solving. The company's work ambience is very appreciative, and you'll find them always being supportive of each other. I took part mostly in assisting the optimization of the TPS 3R project, which was challenging, but I learned a lot and am still learning more about it

items.name: Fanny Ramadhanti
items.message: Working in a social enterprise that focuses on giving services in responsible waste management taught me a whole new lesson. I learned a lot of new skills, especially about business and waste management, which was the most exciting thing that I never had before. I can express and sharpen my skills in event and project management, partnership, teamwork, and public speaking

items.name: Ivanna Zahra
items.message: This internship provided me with valuable hands-on experience and a better idea about what knowledge areas and skills I should develop. I learned various types of HR functions and responsibilities, such as recruitment process, people development and designing performance appraisal. This is also my first time working with an output-based mechanism, which means we are not tied with regular office hours, but instead focusing on the project's goals and timelines. In order to adapt, I learned how to work effectively, produced a high quality output, and set priorities.

items.name: Khusnaedi Azhar
items.message: After 3 months of internship, I gained a deep understanding on how we can co-exist with waste. We don't need to go back to ancient times where we can't enjoy the simplicity of a product, but rather create a harmony to build a safe and sustainable ecosystem, just like a forest. Waste4change is trying to make that ecosystem where waste management could be handled responsibly with a holistic 4Cs approach: Consult, Campaign, Collect and Create.
